Media: The New York Times
Review: Yes, it really is that good...I am loath to tell people to mortgage their houses and lease their children to acquire tickets to a hit Broadway show. But 'Hamilton,' directed by Thomas Kail and starring Mr. Miranda, might just about be worth it <U+2014> at least to anyone who wants proof that the American musical is not only surviving but also evolving in ways that should allow it to thrive and transmogrify in years to come.

Media: Theatermania
Review: Yes, it's as incredible as everyone says....With his new musical, 'Hamilton,' Lin-Manuel Miranda has an eye on both. He's created a work sure to be enjoyed by generations to come, proudly drawing on America's past as a guiding light to the future. It unequivocally asserts that the revolutionary ideals of 1776 are still valid in 2015. It is nothing short of a masterpiece, destined to change Broadway forever.

Media: BroadwayWorld
Review: As with 'In The Heights', Miranda's ear-popping material kinetically fuses with the exemplary work of director Thomas Kail to explosively tell the story of a man considered one of the first quintessential New Yorkers - a poor immigrant with radical ideas who pushed his way to prominence for the betterment of society.

Media: Time Out New York
Review: What is left to say  After every critic in town (including me) praised the Public Theater world premiere to high heaven; and after seeing this language-drunk, rhyme-crazy dynamo a second time, I can only marvel: They used up all the damn words. Wait, here are three stragglers, straight from the heart: I love 'Hamilton.' I love it like I love New York, or Broadway when it gets it right. And this is so right.

Media: New York Post
Review: Lin-Manuel Miranda<U+2019>s 'In the Heights' may have been a hit <U+2014> but his 'Hamilton' is a phenomenon...But <U+201C>revolutionary<U+201D> the show is not. Truly radical art is divisive, and under its brash exterior, 'Hamilton' is warmly reassuring <U+2014> a love letter to a land of opportunity where 'The 10-dollar founding father without a father/Got a lot farther by working a lot harder/By being a lot smarter/By being a self-starter.'<U+201D>

Media: Variety
Review: This innovative show is shaping up to be just as much of a phenomenon uptown, playing in a Broadway house with four times the seating capacity, and to a more traditional but no less enthusiastic audience. That universal appeal to crossover audiences is one unmistakable sign of a groundbreaking show...Like any true landmark, 'Hamilton' stands up to repeated viewings. After six months, the show<U+2019>s initial impact hasn<U+2019>t dulled a bit; in fact, the qualities that made it so extraordinary the first...

Media: The Hollywood Reporter
Review: Having already become a cultural phenomenon in its off-Broadway premiere run earlier this year at the Public Theater, 'Hamilton' <U+2014> written by and starring Lin-Manuel Miranda, who previously made a name for himself on Broadway with 'In the Heights' <U+2014> seems a shoo-in for smash hit status and a slew of awards attention...The musical is a triumph.

Media: The Huffington Post
Review: 'Hamilton' is not just an excellent and rousing musical; it brings something new to the musical theatre, and does it so very compellingly that superlatives are in order. I--and I expect just about all my critical colleagues--would tell you to stop reading right now and get yer tickets, except there aren't likely many to be had for the next year or three.

Media: DC Theatre Scene
Review: When Hamilton opened  -Broadway in February, I called it groundbreaking and breathtaking <U+2013> and I was trying not to gush...Analyzing the importance of 'Hamilton' misses the main takeaway from the musical: It<U+2019>s thrilling to watch. It seems always in motion, thanks to a creative team including director Thomas Kail, and especially choreographer Andy Blankenbuehler, who keeps the sexy ensemble very busy. They help enhance what are some terrific performances.

Media: Talkin' Broadway
Review: Does 'Hamilton' live up to all <U+2014> any <U+2014> of this hype  And does it need to  From my perspective, the answers are, respectively, a definite no and a solid yes...Though much has been made of the myriad musical and lyrical references that pockmark the evening, they're more about calling attention to themselves than contributing to a consistent texture or sensible narrative. To my reckoning they brand 'Hamilton,' even in its slightly altered, more precise uptown incarnation, as unsatisfying and un...

Media: The Wall Street Journal
Review: 'Hamilton' is the best and most important Broadway musical of the past decade. Why important  Because it sounds as though it had been written last week instead of a half-century ago...So do whatever you have to do short of grand larceny to score a ticket to 'Hamilton.' It<U+2019>ll make you want to stand on your seat and yell with delight.

Media: The Clyde Fitch Report
Review: 'Hamilton' joins the ranks of great American musicals...Considered as an American musical dealing directly with Americana an argument could eventually be made for 'Hamilton' as the nation<U+2019>s greatest musical...If a musical even close in quality to this one emerges this season, we<U+2019>re lucky. If a musical even close in quality emerges in the next 10 years, we<U+2019>d better count our lucky stars.

Media: AM New York
Review: I must confess that I gave one of the less enthusiastic reviews of 'Hamilton' back in February, finding the plot to be too dense (it is, after all, a biography) and the hip-hop sound to be monotonous. On second viewing, I was determined to accept the show on its own terms, and I ended up being absolutely entranced by Miranda's inventive writing, Thomas Kail's masterful direction and Andy Blankenbuehler's nonstop movement. I may be the last critic to join the 'Hamilton' fan club, but better l...

Media: New York Magazine / Vulture
Review: A second look suggests that something even more significant is going on. The breakthrough isn<U+2019>t so much the incorporation of those contemporary genres; after all, Miranda already did that, throwing in Latin music to boot, in the charming 'In the Heights.' But 'Hamilton' not only incorporates newish-to-Broadway song forms; it requires and advances them, in the process opening up new territory for exploitation. It<U+2019>s the musical theater, not just American history, that gets refurbished. And per..

Media: New York Daily News
Review: With 'Hamilton,' Broadway is officially the coolest place on the planet. And the smartest. And most exhilarating. Yes, composer, lyricist, author and leading man Lin-Manuel Miranda<U+2019>s magical musical tour of the life of the '10-dollar Founding Father,' Alexander Hamilton, is that great. It<U+2019>s even richer and more eloquent since its run earlier this year at the Public Theater.

Media: Deadline
Review: Every great musical improves on second (and third, and fourth) hearing; 'Hamilton' is no exception. Lin-Manuel Miranda<U+2019>s magnificent adaptation is not, to use that tired clich<U+00E9>, a game-changer. It is, in truth, the quintessence of a Broadway musical destined for the record books...Like 'Rent' 20 years ago and 'A Chorus Line' 40 years so, 'Hamilton' is accessible without pandering and inspirational in sneaky ways that permeate a skeptic<U+2019>s shell.

Media: Chicago Tribune
Review: The Founding Father never had a friend so loyal and true as Lin-Manuel Miranda, whose audaciously ambitious and supremely executed new musical is surely the most entertaining, provocative and moving civics lesson in Broadway history...Many of the songs are quite staggeringly beautiful <U+2014> richly melodic and passionately performed ballads of fear, hope, determination and pain. They feel traditional and revolutionary at the same time.

Media: Newsday
Review: With the delirious praise swirling around 'Hamilton' since its Public Theater run, there was danger that Lin-Manuel Miranda's hip-hop masterwork would seem anticlimactic - or at least overhyped - at its Broadway premiere. Instead, the show is even more nuanced, more cohesive in individual performances and its more focused finale. Most important, Miranda and director Thomas Kail have fine-tuned it without losing a shiver of its audacity and thrill.

Media: Theatre Reviews Limited
Review: With a refreshing book, profoundly innovative music that includes hip-hop, jazz, blues, R&B, and Broadway, and scintillating lyrics, 'Hamilton' exceeds all expectations of theatergoers and rocks the stage with engaging performances and exhilarating choreography...The diverse cast is uniformly outstanding and brilliant...Andy Blankenbuehler<U+2019>s choreography is innovative and precise.

Media: The Wrap
Review: It<U+2019>s the question most asked of theater critics these days: 'Is <U+2018>Hamilton<U+2019> really that good ' Yes, 'Hamilton' is that good, and the still youthful Lin-Manuel Miranda can be mentioned in the same sentence with Sondheim and even Cole Porter.

Media: NorthJersey.com
Review: The first question critics usually consider when a hit off-Broadway show moves to Broadway is whether it works as well in a larger space. 'Hamilton' does. Emphatically...It<U+2019>s an event that hasn<U+2019>t been over-hyped. The show is spectacularly unique, an endlessly clever history lesson that links us to the country<U+2019>s Founding Fathers in an ingenious and compelling theatrical way...There are probably a half-dozen more things I could rave about, but, essentially, 'Hamilton' is just a really, really ...

Media: TheaterScene.net
Review: <U+201C><U+2018>Hamilton<U+2019> does for the American Revolution what <U+2018>Les Miserables<U+2019> does for French 19th century history. However, its contemporary sound turns <U+2018>Hamilton<U+2019> into a theatrical revolution that is just short of titanic. From the expert cast to the impeccable design team to the splendid score and text, <U+2018>Hamilton<U+2019> makes musical theater history. Just a warning: don<U+2019>t  come tired! <U+2018>Hamilton<U+2019> is fast moving and jam-packed with information. You will want all your faculties about you.<U+201D>

Media: Front Mezz Junkies
Review: I was intoxicated by 'Hamilton', exquisitely directed by Thomas Kail...It has an energy, a beat, a rhythm, and a rebelliousness that swept me up and kept me thoroughly engaged and enchanted. It<U+2019>s a powerhouse three-hour telling of this pushy historical figure...Act One is an adrenaline-fueled history lesson in politics, war, revolution and love but Act Two is the clincher, which gives this show its emotional core and depth.  It is truly amazing what Miranda has done here.

Media: Bob's Theater Blog
Review: This ambitious, inventive show remains strong across the board: the entertaining, informative and emotionally involving book is filled with moments of humor and pathos, the characters are vividly drawn, the lyrics are extremely clever, the choreography supports the action brilliantly, the cast is uniformly strong and the direction is fluid and assured...The good news is that the newcomers to the cast are generally fine and the production is as sharp as ever.

Media: WNBC
Review: Miranda<U+2019>s sweeping, largely sung-through musical about Alexander Hamilton, an orphan who became George Washington<U+2019>s right-hand man, took on a second life as a master class in musical theater creation...Miranda<U+2019>s music and lyrics are too textured to be absorbed in one sitting. Turns out, once you<U+2019>ve gotten over the first wow, there<U+2019>s plenty more wow to be uncovered.

Review (Don't): Don't see it if female characters largely passive, don't feel emotional connection to A. Hamilton until late in 2nd act=Also It is heartening to see that an immensely popular musical like Hamilton is actually a serious piece of theater, focusing on ambitious themes like the relationship of fathers and sons, duty to country vs. family, attributes of passion vs. caution, who defines our history, etc. while animating and showing the foibles of major Revolutionary War figures whom we have - until now - worshiped from afar. Contrast this with other popular musicals of their time: Cats, Phantom, etc. that are largely forgettable entertainments....<U+00A0>Read more Read less=

Media: CitiTour
Review: The show creates a swirling intellectual and emotional portrait of one individual that matches, if not bests, any we<U+2019>ve previously seen on stage. To accomplish this rare feat, Miranda is aided by the seamless direction of Thomas Kail, the extraordinary, and the stirring orchestrations of Alex Lacamoire, who finds the precisely right sounds for Miranda<U+2019>s wonderfully wide musical vocabulary<U+2026>Its inventiveness is practically unparalleled. Miranda<U+2019>s book is a marvel, as well.

Media: The Associated Press
Review: Revolutions are messy, sudden, often brutal things. They're not meant to mature gracefully. Thankfully, no one told the creators of the pulsating 'Hamilton,' which arrives on Broadway sharper, tighter and cleaner than just a few months ago....It's all like nothing you've ever heard or seen before. In one song, the main ladies sing euphorically, 'Look around at how lucky we are to be alive right now! History is happening in Manhattan.' We couldn't agree more.

Media: NY1
Review: It was phenomenal off-Broadway. It's even better now. 'Hamilton' is that rare musical that fires on all cylinders, even ones we never knew existed...In a sense, the collective talents of this bravura company pay homage to Broadway's founding fathers - and mothers - by pushing the envelope on an artform that at best, teaches us, enlightens us and entertains us like nothing else.

Media: The Washington Post
Review: 'Hamilton' is a captivating mirror of the man whose life it surveys: blazingly original, restlessly innovative, magnetic from start to finish...The intense pride you feel on an evening such as this, when America<U+2019>s story is retold with such style, verve and imagination, is not of a sort that<U+2019>s come by easily on Broadway. There<U+2019>s a magnitude of joy summoned here that suggests that King George is absolutely right. You most certainly will want to be back.

Media: Towleroad
Review: The landmark new musical presents a soulful, electrifying retelling of America<U+2019>s birth. Its ingenious use of hip-hop, a medium and a culture in many ways born from that oppression, to reclaim American history is nothing short of revolutionary...The musical<U+2019>s ability to combine the sensational with the theoretical is one of its greatest strengths.

Media: USA Today
Review: There has been nothing on Broadway in the past 20 years to rival the riveting, exhilarating and haunting 'Hamilton,' its vitality and ingenuity fully intact...American musicals have long combined social criticism with unabashed romance, a sharp eye with an open heart. Watching that tradition move boldly forward in 'Hamilton,' a fan can't help but feel a little pride.

Media: As Her World Turns
Review: What can I say that hasn<U+2019>t already been said about this lauded new musical, perhaps the best this art form has seen in decades  It lives up to the hype. It is indeed brilliant...Composer, lyricist, and star Lin-Manuel Miranda seamlessly blends musical theater and hip hop in a wholly original way...'Hamilton' is as epic as 'Les Mis' and as relevant as a Jay Z album. It is nothing less than revolutionary.

Media: ZEALnyc
Review: It<U+2019>s even better than I remembered. 'Hamilton' is something entirely new to Broadway. And also something entirely old...You<U+2019>ll leave 'Hamilton' humming. And teary-eyed. And in awe that someone <U+2013> Lin-Manuel Miranda in this case <U+2013> can conceive of, write, and star in something so moving, so compelling, so<U+2026>well, genius.

Media: BroadwaySelect
Review: <U+201C>Miranda puts eloquence in every mouth<U+2026><U+2018>Hamilton<U+2019> does offer enough musical theater touchstones to please the purist...Tom Kail<U+2019>s direction and Andy Blankenbuehler<U+2019>s choreography make for a seamless, sure-handed musical replete with stunning stage pictures...So Miranda has become one of those comparatively rare musical theater writers who follows his first success ('In the Heights') with a much greater triumph.

Media: Theatre is Easy
Review: With Kail's clever direction and Blankenbuhler's athletic choreography, 'Hamilton's' large cast embodies a bloody war, heated political rivalries, and the outright joy of starting a new nation...Miranda's score is a triumph by itself with a wide range of influences and some of the best lyric writing seen yet this century...The modernity of the production is refreshing and prescient<U+2014>we might actually be entering a new era of musical theatre.

Media: StageZine
Review: Director Thomas Kail keeps the story moving along with fluid precision and at an exhausting, nonstop pace at all times. The fusion of direction and choreography complement each other in the frenetic goings-on in this nearly three-hour, monumental show. 'Hamilton' has truly started a Broadway revolution and will continue to influence the American musical theater for years to come.

Media: BackStage Barbie
Review: This show is so special and unlike anything we have ever seen on Broadway...What strikes me is that it is so commercially successful, but before it was popular it was extremely well written and artistic. It is rare that these combine in a musical...'Hamilton' has shown the next generation of composers that you can write something intelligent with artistic merit and still sell tickets.

Media: Our Theater Blog
Review: <U+201C>'Hamilton' is still a perfect 10!...This tuneful sampling is a brilliant reflection of the spirit of revolution and renewal that 'Hamilton' (and the period it depicts) represents...'Hamilton,' under Thomas Kail<U+2019>s direction of the no-less than brilliant cast and with Andy Blankenbuehler<U+2019>s choreography for the excellent ensemble of 'back-up' dancers and players, is the most entertaining history lesson ever devised. 'Hamilton' is no less than genius!

Media: Entertainment Weekly
Review: Lin-Manuel Miranda has turned a Founding Father<U+2019>s largely forgotten narrative into one of the most joyful, kinetic, and extravagantly original musicals ever imagined for the stage...The play<U+2019>s intrigue comes mostly from its potent stew of friendship and romance and outsize ambition; it<U+2019>s as if 'House of Cards' were folded into a sort of 'Days of Our Colonial Lives' fever dream, then filtered through the minds of Tupac and Sondheim. It<U+2019>s that strange and that spectacular, and you<U+2019>d be crazy t...

Media: Boston Globe
Review: In his stylish and electrifying 'Hamilton,' Miranda fuses the immediacy and storytelling power of hip-hop and R&B with the revolutionary passions of a new nation heaving itself into existence... Arriving on Broadway burdened with the weight of expectation, having become a much-coveted ticket, 'Hamilton<U+2019> proves more than able to carry that weight. This musical is young, scrappy, hungry <U+2014> and exhilarating.

Media: The Three Tomatoes
Review: Would 'Hamilton' really live up to the hype  The evening I went, there was electricity in the air. A great sense of excited anticipation. And when the lights dimmed, before the first note was sung, the audience began to cheer. Does 'Hamilton' live up to all of this  Well, yes, it actually does...Even though 'Hamilton' is nearly three hours long, it does not feel tedious...As soon as 'Hamilton' ended, I wanted to see it again. Now, that is the way to kick off a Broadway season.

Media: ThisbroadSway
Review: You will never enjoy a story of the American Revolution more than this one as written and told by Lin-Manuel Miranda...This was not so much about the story for me as it was about how the story was told by this beautifully sculpted and colorful; mainly African-American and Latino cast...This production is truly masterful, and brings a modern twist to nearly 300-year-old history...This show fills the stage, and will fill every one of your senses.

Media: The New York Times
Review: for a previous production  They<U+2019>re brewing up a revolution down on Lafayette Street. <U+201C>Hamilton,<U+201D> Lin-Manuel Miranda<U+2019>s independent-minded new musical for the masses, shot open like a streamlined cannon ball. When one of the young rebels who populate this vibrant work says, <U+201C>History is happening in Manhattan,<U+201D> you can only nod in happy agreement....Ambitious, enthusiastic and talented in equal measures, Mr. Miranda embodies those sentiments in a show that aims impossibly high and hits its target.

Media: BroadwayWorld
Review: for a previous production  Lin-Manuel Miranda may not have invented the concept of having historical characters speak and sing in contemporary pop vernacular, but in the explosively intelligent and pulse-pumping new musical Hamilton, he and his collaborators have lifted the idea to rarely achieved levels of musical theatre sophistication...Hamilton is a crowning achievement.

Media: Time Out New York
Review: for a previous production  History ticks to a syncopated beat in Lin-Manuel Miranda<U+2019>s jubilant, overflowingly rich Hamilton. And just as syncopation achieves its energizing effect by disturbing the expected flow, so Miranda<U+2019>s biomusical is a rhythm-and-rhyme intervention for American iconography and ideology...Not just for its lyrical virtuosity, but also structural elegance and fierce topicality, the piece is a signal achievement. In remixing the past to his own beat, Miranda shows us the future.

Media: New York Post
Review: for a previous production  For months now, a deafening buzz has surrounded <U+201C>Hamilton.<U+201D> Rumor had it that creator and star Lin-Manuel Miranda would apply his magic hip-hop touch to Alexander Hamilton and the American Revolution, and make them cool. Well, mission half-accomplished. At its best, <U+201C>Hamilton<U+201D> is giddily exciting...The production itself is sterling. Yet the show is burdened with eye-glazingly dull stretches, especially those involving George Washington.

Media: Variety
Review: for a previous production  In Lin-Manuel Miranda<U+2019>s brilliantly inventive bio-musical, <U+201C>Hamilton,<U+201D> the great man is winningly imagined as an orphaned immigrant, a political rebel, a reckless lover, and a non-stop talker <U+2014> clearly, a born rapper. There should be a huge audience for this irresistible show...In the end, Miranda<U+2019>s impassioned narrative of one man<U+2019>s story becomes the collective narrative of a nation, a nation built by immigrants who occasionally need to be reminded where they came from.

Media: The Guardian (UK)
Review: for a previous production  This exuberant and original new musical mashes up genres from rap to operetta, creating a flawed but glorious portrait of the face on the $10 bill...This isn't parody and it isn't even pastiche. But the styles complement and clash so extravagantly and exuberantly that they create new genres of their own...With a show this brash and nimble, this historically engaged and startlingly contemporary, Miranda confirms his promise as one hell of a teller.

Media: The Hollywood Reporter
Review: for a previous production  American history comes to thrilling life in a wildly entertaining musical that fulfills its considerable ambitions...It's a dense, nearly entirely sung-through musical, featuring more than a dozen major characters and nearly three times as many musical numbers that incorporate myriad styles, including heavy doses of rap. But it all flows together beautifully in a torrent of music and language that is as exhilarating as it is educational.

Media: The Huffington Post

Media: AM New York
Review: for a previous production  <U+201C>Hamilton,<U+201D> a new rap musical about the life and times of founding father Alexander Hamilton, has been more eagerly anticipated than any other show this season...Having finally seen <U+201C>Hamilton<U+201D> for myself, I can report that it<U+2019>s dynamic and smart but hardly a masterwork <U+2013> at least not yet. In its current form, it is raw, overstuffed as a narrative and far too long (just under three hours).

Media: New York Magazine / Vulture
Review: for a previous production  I don't mean to suggest that you're unpatriotic if you aren't moved by Hamilton, Lin-Manuel Miranda's sensational new hip-hop biomusical at the Public. But in order to dislike it you'd pretty much have to dislike the American experiment. It brings the complexity of forming a union from disparate constituencies right to your ears...But for all its complexity -- its multistrand plotting and exploding rhyme-grenades -- Hamilton is neither a challenge nor a chore. It's just great.

Media: Deadline
Review: for a previous production  Hamilton is the rare show critics leave the theater thinking, This is the future of Broadway...This phenomenal production honors the inexhaustible verbal wordplay and musical breadth that connects Miranda to Broadway<U+2019>s greats. At  unexpected moments the score just soars on choral wings. I left Hamilton not only exhilarated and eager to see it again but also full of anticipation about where Lin-Manuel Miranda will take us next.

Media: Newsday
Review: for a previous production  Thanks to  Hamilton,  a thrilling, audacious, deliriously overloaded invention by Lin-Manuel Miranda, this lost founding father has not only been found alive beyond the $10 bill. His story is suddenly a cross-cultural milestone in musical theater...The program cover asks  who lives, who dies, who tells your story.  Hamilton could never have imagined who would tell this one. He is in brash and brilliant hands.

Media: NorthJersey.com
Review: for a previous production
Review (Don't): Hamilton,  Lin-Manuel Miranda's extraordinary, stunningly imaginative musical, is so rich in so many ways, it's hard to know where to start...a show that flows with grace and energy, fueled by staged movement and dance. It's as winning in style as it is in substance. Finally, there's a wonderful cast supporting Miranda's intense portrayal of Hamilton... Hamilton  is to be treasured for the chances it takes, and more so for the brilliant way it succeeds.

Media: The Associated Press
Review: for a previous production  Over-hyped  Perhaps. But this almost three-hour show, with some 50 songs, reprises and song fragments <U+2014> is also rollicking, messy, and earnest <U+2014> just like America's founding...Edgy without being scary, historical without being dry. It's hip-hop with a master's degree...It's nothing less than a reclaiming of America's founding story, a retelling of the 18th century story by a nontraditional cast wearing vests and cravats and singing about  dropping knowledge.  In its own way, it's a revolutio..

Media: The Washington Post
Review: for a previous production  Lin-Manuel Miranda is showing us the way. To anyone who might suggest musical theater has hit a creative dead end, the actor-songwriter unfolds a spectacularly persuasive counter<U+00AD>argument in the myriad melodious <U+00AD>masterstrokes of <U+201C>Hamilton<U+201D>...It<U+2019>s all here, in a breathtaking pageant. The creative energy Miranda infuses into <U+201C>Hamilton<U+201D> is on a par with the manic spirit of his subject. It<U+2019>s a dynamite ride, just trying to keep up with both of them.

Media: USA Today
Review: for a previous production  Rapping flows seamlessly into singing, with soaring melodies shifting to dazzling displays of rhythm and rhyme that mine the inherent theatricality of hop-hop. In Miranda's sensitive portrayal, Hamilton emerges as a man more comfortable with language and ideas than with people. Live entertainment doesn't get more exciting than this, in any form. So believe the hype: Hamilton is revolutionary in its own right, and an extraordinary achievement.

Media: Script with Dan Dwyer
Review: for a previous production  This powerful, audacious musical biography not only illuminates the historical origins of the American national identity with startling clarity heretofore unseen in musical theater but also rockets the musical genre into a bold, definitively 21st-century, multicultural expression of language and music...Director Kail propels Hamilton<U+2019>s saga forward like a page-turning historical novel...Miranda claims the forefront in musical theater storytelling with authority.

Media: Entertainment Weekly
Review: for a previous production  Amazing, thrillingly multi-layered new musical...The show's instantly memorable, freestyle-flavored score could have carried the evening plenty far on its own. The decision to cast the show with an eye on multiculturalism-actors rarely bear any resemblance to their real-life counterparts-is nothing short of inspired...Alexander Hamilton may be best known for being the face of 10 bucks, but Hamilton will make you feel like a million of <U+2018>em.

Media: WNBC
Review: for a previous production  Hamilton is by far the most exciting new musical of the year, with its infectious score, powerhouse performances and fresh take on a seemingly stale subject. It effectively uses the music of another generation <U+2014> hip-hop <U+2014> to tell the story of one of the history<U+2019>s underappreciated heroes. Many of the songs <U+2014> especially those infused with a hip-hop or R&B beat <U+2014> sound like they could live at the top of today<U+2019>s music charts, easily with Ne-Yo or Pharrell behind them.

Media: Hot Pepper Theater
Review: for a previous production  The entire show is sung and rapped through<U+2014>it's just music, which is great. And a lot of it is very complex music...not a complete game-changer for musicals but a subtle one. It uses music to tell the story in a beautiful way. That's all it does. It's the opposite of 1776.

Media: Vogue
Review: for a previous production  Hamilton is, quite simply, a great musical. With its propulsive, tuneful, hyper-verbally dexterous score and its combination of profane wit and high feeling<U+2014>not to mention a sensational, great-looking, multiethnic cast<U+2014>it<U+2019>s also the most sheerly entertaining musical to come along since The Book of Mormon...Hamilton will thrill you and, maybe, bring you to tears for what it reveals about the past and what it promises for the future.

Almost every element, from the lighting and choreography to the costumes and the performances by everyone on stage is crafted and fine tuned and yet feels fresh and exciting. My only small challenge was that some of the lyrics got lost unless you were familiar with the soundtrack. The replacement cast lived up to the hype of the original and as it is such an ensemble piece the group dynamic and shared energy was contagious. Review: See it if You want to see perfect theater. Believe the hype. Miranda took a lengthy biography, found a villain and gave the story dramatic arc.
Review (Don't): Don't see it if You can't afford it. Buy the tickets anyway. Charge it! Mortgage your house.=Also My expectations for this show were through the roof. Hamilton shattered my expectations and blew me away. To think that a genius mind could take a historical biography, that can be a slog to read, and turn it into an exciting show is amazing. The score and lyrics are smart, articulate and brilliantly written. You love some of the characters and realize that the recent election was just politics as usual. This type of politicking has been going on for 250+ years. Had Hamilton kept his zipper up and become POTUS his wife would have made a beloved First Lady. Her last song, about her accomplishments in her last 50 years, was astounding. While she was doing it all in 'Hamilton's' name, she also made great contributions to our country in its formative years.See this show. It is art. It is important. It is educational all while being ridiculously entertaining....<U+00A0>Read more Read less

Media: Epic, Must see, Refreshing, Resonant, Great staging  MitchReviews
Review: See it if You like history or hate history, if you like musicals or hate musicals, if you like hiphop or hate it...just see it. Everyone should see it
Review (Don't): Don't see it if you generally hate things that are critically acclaimed and literally everyone else loves.=Also Hamilton is a phenomenon for a reason: it will blow you away. The complex and emotional storytelling deeply rooted in history coupled with a vibrant range of music will make you laugh, cry, think and just wow you. This epic story told through incredible dancing, acting, rapping, and singing reminds us all of the best that the United States has to offer: a chance for everyone to succeed, inclusion of all peoples and the ability to start a revolution. Even if you've listened to the cast recording a billion times and think you know this show, it still will surprise you at every turn. It's better than you can imagine. There's something for everyone: a love story, political intrigue, explosive battles in action and more. Don't worry that now that the original cast is gone, this show stands out on its own. Hamilton demonstrates the power of diverse groups of people coming together in a divisive time to celebrate our common humanity. The hype is real because this is really just that amazing....<U+00A0>Read more Read less=

It is rather long too, so don't expect to be in and out.=Also I have 2 major criticisms of this musical. 1. I get that things were simplified in order to create a cohesive and riveting story, though when you go through it point by point, there are A LOT of inaccuracies. I mean, like about 50% inaccurate. The most glaring one that I think could have been worked around easily was showing how Hamilton left the Treasury department. The conveniences they used in this situation are almost cringe-worthy if you've even read one book on the founding of our country. 2. The transitions from song to song are abrupt, almost to the point that you feel they are singing only because it is the next song to sing, not because they are driven to do so. With that said - it is still the best musical in a decade IMHO, though I do like the original performance of Les Miz a little better....<U+00A0>Read more Read less=

Review (Don't): Also Hamilton is the only broadway musical I have ever liked. I don't even like rap. But, the musical was so clever, and Lin-Manuel Miranda's writing was brilliant. The lyrics were beautiful, and very well thought out. Also, the original cast is amazing. They have the voices of angels, and their rapping is on point. And off stage, they're hilarious. Especially Jonathan and Lin. Lin-Manuel did an absolutely amazing job on this whole musical. I also got a bit more into history. I had never even heard Alexander Hamilton's name before, and now I could tell you almost anything about him. I think Hamilton is the best musical of all time, and I've seen a few musicals before. My sister is very much into broadway. Lin deserves many awards for this show. And the cast also deserves awards because their acting is amazing. Hamilton has made me smile and laugh when all I wanted to do was cry. I'm actually thankful for Lin, and the rest of the Hamilton cast for making this happen. Hamilton makes my day....<U+00A0>Read more Read less=
